qas.question: What is the most common cause of diarrhea?
What can cause an infection in the intestines?
What are the three types of diarrhea?

answers.text: short duration watery diarrhea, short duration bloody diarrhea, and if it lasts for more than two weeks, persistent diarrhea

qas.question: What is it known as if blood is present?
What is the most common cause of cholera?
What causes and infection by dysentery?

plausible_answers.text: lactose intolerance, inflammatory bowel disease, a number of medications, and irritable bowel syndrome

qas.question: Name some examples of non-infectious causes of hyperthyroidism?

plausible_answers.text: short duration watery diarrhea, short duration bloody diarrhea, and if it lasts for more than two weeks, persistent diarrhea

qas.question: What are three types of inflammatory bowel disease?
What is acquired from food and water contaminated by cholera?

context: The most common cause is <a0_0><b4_0><b8_0>an infection<b8_0/> of the intestines<b4_0/><a0_0/> due to either <a1_0><b5_0>a virus, bacteria, or parasite<b5_0/><a1_0/>; a condition known as gastroenteritis. These infections are often acquired from food or water that has been contaminated by stool, or directly from another person who is infected. It may be divided into three types: <a2_0><b7_0>short duration watery diarrhea, short duration bloody diarrhea, and if it lasts for more than two weeks, persistent diarrhea<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The short duration watery diarrhea may be due to an infection by cholera, although this is rare in the developed world. If blood is present it is also known as <a3_0>dysentery<a3_0/>. A number of non-infectious causes may also result in diarrhea, including hyperthyroidism, <b6_0>lactose intolerance, inflammatory bowel disease, a number of medications, and irritable bowel syndrome<b6_0/>. In most cases, stool cultures are not required to confirm the exact cause.
